text: [Music]
threats the largest online consignment
store for women's and children's clothes
we process over two million items every
month across all our distribution
centers in the US and we use technology
at the center of everything we do to get
that done when we founded thredUP
nine years ago we are early on Amazon
Web Services for our back end and for
the most part those were handcrafted
servers we've configured them just to
get them out as fast as we could but
there was no standardization and as we
kept growing that became a bigger and
bigger chore to manage moving towards
cloud native technologies like
kubernetes really unlocks our ability to
experiment quickly and learn from
customers along the way it's really
important to a company like us who's
disrupting the retail industry to make
sure that as we're building software and
getting it out in front of our users we
can do it on a fast cycle and learn a
ton as we experiment one of the main
motivators in moving us towards this new
type of infrastructure was to really
make sure that our engineers could
embrace the DevOps mindset as they built
software it was really important to us
that they could own the lifecycle from
end to end from conception at design
through shipping it and running it in
production thread ups a fast growing
company so one of the things that was
really important to us as we moved to
kubernetes is to enable auto scaling in
a seamless and easily manageable way on
days like Black Friday we no longer have
to sit there adding instances monitoring
the traffic doing a lot of manual work
it's automated and it's handled for us
from the system one of the great things
that cloud native technologies is
brought to our engineering team is
unlocking their ability to write
software and get it live in front of
customers delivering our value to them
faster without having to worry about the
nuts and bolts of what's going on under
the hood our future is all about
automation and behind that cloud native
technologies are gonna unlock our
ability to embrace that and go full
force towards the future
[Music]
